DOC.brief_summary: Patients present ED chief complaint acute low back pain provide physician feel symptomatic treatment appropriate ED screen inclusion study . The purpose study compare Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation ( TENS ) adjunct ibuprofen treatment acute low back pain emergency department . Therefore , aim prospective , randomize , double blind study evaluate efficacy ED administer TENS acute low back pain patient ED visit .
DOC.brief_title: TENS Treatment Plus Ibuprofen Treatment Acute Back Pain ED
DOC.detailed_description: The study double blind , randomize , placebo control trial . One group receive ibuprofen TENS . The comparison group receive ibuprofen sham TENS . The study primary endpoint change pain level Visual Analog Scale score 45-60 minute TENS start . This two-arm , double blind , randomize control trial evaluate patient perceive improvement back pain . Patients first fill Visual Analog Scale ( VAS ) . Patients randomize one two arm . Ibuprofen 800 mg , plus sham TENS 45 minute Ibuprofen 800 mg , plus TENS 45 minute Patients give 2nd VAS scale 15 minute end TENS session . After second VAS patient finish study procedure continue care per discretion treat physician . Our intention detect 20 % reduction pain VAS common standard deviation equal difference p = 0.05 level power 80 % use analysis variance ( ANOVA ) . The calculated sample size require 28 patient per group . Considering uncertain dropout rate , investigator decide enroll least 66 patient . Baseline characteristic calculate determine group equal . A two-way repeated-measures ANOVA use test trial effect group effect ( SPSS 20 , SPSS Inc. , Chicago , IL ) . Data present mean standard deviation 95 % confidence interval . A p < 0.05 consider statistically significant .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients 18 year 65 year age present emergency room primary complaint low back pain . 2 . Patient receive 800mg dose ibuprofen part treatment regimen back pain 3 . Back pain new last 48 hour 4 . Deemed treat physician musculoskeletal back pain , central/peripheral nervous system pathology cause pain . 1 . Allergy ibuprofen . 2 . Hypotension ( MAP < 65 Systolic BP < 100 ) , fever , tachycardia 3 . Paresthesias , isolate motor weakness , objective sensory deficit physical exam 4 . Radicular symptom 5 . Urinary incontinence retention 6 . Bowel incontinence 7 . Unexplained weight loss > 15 lb last 3 month . 8 . Multiple primary complaint ED . 9 . Received Analgesia Ibuprofen part ED work . 10 . Taken prescription strength pain medication within last 12 hour condition . 11 . History active malignancy , HIV , organ transplantation , active hemodialysis 12 . Currently pregnant 13 . Nursing home resident 14 . Currently police custody
